Representation.Label: Megalothorax incertus Börner, 1903 sensu Schneider & Panina (2023)
Megalothorax laevis Denis, 1948 sensu Schneider et al. (2018)
Megalothorax rubidus Salmon, 1946
Representation.Detail: Character states pulled from Salmon, 1946, Schneider 2014 (unpublished doctoral thesis), Schneider et al. (in prep)

Representation.Label: Dorsally on head, thorax and abdomen
Dorsal body chaetotaxy: chaetae shape (head and/or trunk)
With ordinary or moderatly thickened chaetae (1)
Thin or ordinary, sub-equal to anterior chaetae
Absent or not reaching the dorsal part of the head
Head: posterior integumentary channels
Representation.Detail: The head integumentary channels are sometime difficult to fully observe due to their low edge contrast. In doubt, leave this character for the lastest stage of identification.

Representation.Label: As a network (at least one cycle)
Head: dorsal pair of globular organs between the antennae
Head: unpaired chaeta in cl. m. row
Head: cuticular process on clypeal area
Head: shape of cuticular process on clypeal area 2
Head: shape of cuticular process on clypeal area
One flat process; anterior to chaeta a0
One elongated, anterior directed process; anterior to chaeta a0
2 or 4 papillae forming a wart; anterior to chaeta a0
Coffee bean shaped; replaces chaeta a0
Head: shape of the connection between linea ventralis and channels
Basomedian field of labium: number of chaetae
Basolateral field of labium: number of chaetae
Forked or with a strong median external tooth
Antenna III: number of ordinary chaetae
Trunk sensory fields (sf3–6): shape of inner chaetae
All flam-shaped (straight or curved swollen chaetae with tapering apex)
Thorax III: position of chaeta p4 relatively to wrc2
Thorax III: relative size of chaeta a5 and a6
a6 and a5 of similar size
Abdomen I–V: shape of s-chaeta s2
Abdomen I–V: length of inner chaetae of sf6
Abd. IV sternites: relative length of chaetae
One pair of chaeta longer that the other one
Abd. IV sternites: number of chaetae
Both smooth or possibly with a notch or some irregularities
At least one side with clear series of teeth
At least one side with a series of crenulations
Elliptical with wide and wavy lamellae
Ordinary, with thin lamellae (no part of the mucro being clearly wider than the basis)
Teeth on most of the mucro length
Smooth apically on 1/3 of the mucro length, teeth on the basal 2/3
Unguis I and unguis III of similar shape
Unguis I longer and thinner than unguis III
Modifed as an extra sensory field (sf7)
Megalothorax incertus Börner, 1903 sensu Schneider & Panina (2023)
Megalothorax laevis Denis, 1948 sensu Schneider et al. (2018)
Megalothorax rubidus Salmon, 1946

Representation.Label: Megalothorax_tasmanterolenis_dorsal_integument_trunk.jpg
Representation.Detail: Distinction between integument devoid of secondary granulation (primary granulation only) and integument covered with secondary granulation, in Megalothorax tasmanterolenis.

Representation.Label: Chaetae_shape_01.jpg
Representation.Detail: 1: ordinary chaeta 2: lanceolate chaeta 3: gladiuform chaeta
